titles.title: To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 504 Hamilton Street in Allentown, Pennsylvania, as the "Edward N. Cahn Federal Building and United States Courthouse".

referral.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

referral.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation.

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 106-57.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 23.

action.text: Mr. Franks moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 751.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.

referral.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

summary.status: Reported to House amended.    (There is 1 other summary)

bill.summary: Designates the Federal building and U.S. courthouse located at 504 West Hamilton Street in Allentown, Pennsylvania, as the Edward N. Cahn Federal Building and United States Courthouse.
